entry.title: Shield Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Blend
Price: 19.95 - 79.95 (5 variants)

Shield Blend (Thieves) is a mixture of undiluted, 100% pure, USDA certified organic essential oils of Clove Bud, Lemon, Cinnamon Bark, Eucalyptus Radiata, and Rosemary. 

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿1 – 2 years

Max dilution: 0.45%

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

This blend is great for a variety of skin issues including eczema, psoriasis, boils, pimples, warts, acne, athlete’s foot, and others.  It also helps fight signs of aging with powerful antioxidants and by improving elasticity.  It is an effective aid in a range respiratory issues from cough and congestion to bacterial and viral infections.  It also supports the immune system and aids digestion.  It will help prevent cuts and wounds from becoming infected as well as speed the healing process.  It is also great for dental health, allergies, cold sores, pain relief, insect bites and stings, and Lyme disease.  On top of all this, it can help ease stress and anxiety.

Around the house the oil can be used to sanitize, remove odors, purify the air, remove adhesives, and destroy mold.

Add a maximum of 1 drop (0.05 mL) to 10 mL of carrier oil (or 0.45%) for topical applications.

Apply mixture and rub into skin on desired area, wrists, neck, abdomen, or during massage.  Avoid freshly broken skin, eyes, and sensitive areas.

 

Safety and Warnings

Shield Blend oil can cause CNS and breathing problems in young children, therefore, avoid use on or near the face of children under 2 years of age.  This oil can interact (through oral routes) with pethidine, MAOIs, indirect sympathomimetics, SSRIs, medications treating blood clotting, major surgery, peptic ulcer, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders.  Avoid using on diseased or damaged skin or if hypersensitive.  This oil may be oil may be embryotoxic and inhibit blood clotting.

This oil can be phototoxic and should not be used topically above concentrations of 6.8% on areas of skin that will be exposed to sunlight in the next 12 hours. 

Below are some potential drug interactions for Shield Blend.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Shield Blend essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate interaction:

  • Diabetes medications (Antidiabetic drugs) such as Amaryl, glyburide (DiaBeta, Glynase PresTab, Micronase), insulin, Actos, Avandia, Diabinese, Glucotrol, Orinase and others.
  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), and others.
  • Verteporfin – effectiveness is reduced.
  • MAOIs – Isocarboxazid (Marplan), Phenelzine (Nardil), Selegiline (Eldepryl, Emsam, Zelapar), Tranylcypromine (Parnate), and others.
  • SSRIs – citalopram (Celexa), escitalopram (Lexapro), fluoxetine (Sarafem, Prozac, Prozac Weekly, Selfemra, Rapiflux), fluvoxamine (Luvox, Luvox CR), paroxetine (Paxil, Paxil CR, Pexeva, Brisdelle), sertraline (Zoloft), and others.

Avoid old or oxidized Shield Blend oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 0.45%

This oil is not safe for children (2 years and under).

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

entry.title: Lemongrass Organic Essential Oil
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Singles
Price: 13.95 - 24.95 (4 variants)

Botanical Name: Cymbopogon Flexuosus

Botanical Family: Poaceae

Main Constituents:
Geranial: 42.47%
Neral: 33.16%

Plant Part: Leaves

Origin: India

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Processing Method: Steam Distilled

﻿Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿1 – 2 Years

Aromatic Scent: A strong top-middle note.  Citrusy, Earthy, Fresh, Herbaceous, Lemony, and slightly Sweet.

Blends Well With: Cedarwood, Lavender, Lemon, Marjoram, Pine, Rosemary, and Thyme.

 

Properties

Antianxiety, Antibacterial, Antidepressant, Antifungal, Anti-inflammatory, Antioxidant, Antipyretic, Antiseptic, Anti-spasmodic, Antiviral, Astringent, Calming, Cephalic, Carminative, CNS tonic, Cooling, Diuretic, Disinfectant, Energizing, Insecticidal, Insect repellent, Nervine, Sedative, Stimulant

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

Add a maximum of 1 drops (0.05 mL) to 10 mL of carrier oil (or 0.7%) for topical applications.

 

Can be used topically to:

  • Reduce pain and inflammation
  • Boost circulation
  • Soothe achy muscles
  • Ease muscle spasms
  • Alleviate headache
  • Detoxify
  • Deodorize
  • Boost digestion
  • Reduce cholesterol
  • Ease stress
  • Fight viruses
  • Kill fungus
  • Treat respiratory infection
  • Fight free radicals
  • Ease menstrual cramps
  • Relieve symptoms of depression
  • Boost immune system
  • Fight fatigue
  • Nourish skin

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Fight viruses
  • Kill fungus
  • Deodorize
  • Alleviate headache
  • Treat respiratory infection
  • Relieve symptoms of depression
  • Boost immune system
  • Fight fatigue
  • Purify the air

Can be used around the house to:

  • Disinfect surfaces/filters – try adding drops or spray to furnace/air/vacuum filters! *avoid open flame
  • Freshen Laundry
  • Remove sticky goo (stickers, glue)

 

Energetics

Lemongrass supports the 1st, 3rd, 4th, and 6th chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand and Young have shown that Lemongrass oil has a low risk of irritation and a low risk of sensitization. [1] 

Lemongrass interacts with anti-diabetic medications and drugs metabolized by CYP2B6.

Below are some of the known drug interactions for Lemongrass.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Lemongrass essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Lemongrass interacts with anti-diabetic medications (through oral routes) and drugs metabolized by CYP2B6 (through all routes).

Moderate interaction:

  • Ketamine
  • Efavirenz (Sustiva and others)
  • Bupropion (Wellbutrin, Zyban and others)
  • Cyclophosphamide (cytophosphane and others)
  • Ifosfamide (Ifex and others)
  • Methadone (Dolophine, Methadose and others)
  • MDMA (ecstasy and others)
  • Thiotepa

Minor interaction:

  • Nicotine

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 0.7%

Avoid during pregnancy and breast feeding.

This oil is not safe for children.

This oil has GRAS status.  (Generally regarded as safe)

 

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014

entry.title: Lemon Organic Essential Oil
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Singles
Price: 13.95 - 28.95 (4 variants)

Botanical Name: Citrus limonum

Botanical Family: Rutaceae

Main Constituents:
Limonene: 55 – 70%

Plant Part: Fruit Peel

Origin: Italy

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Processing Method: Cold Pressed

﻿Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿1 - 2 years

Aromatic Scent: A strong top note.  Bittersweet, Bright, Cool, Fresh, Fruity, and Lemony.

Blends Well With: Angelica Root, Bergamot, Frankincense frereana, Lime, Orange, Mandarin and Rosalina

 

Properties

Anti-anxiety, Anti-bacterial, Anti-depressant, Anti-fungal, Anit-infectious, Anti-inflammatory, Antioxidant, Anti-rheumatic, Anti-septic, Anti-spasmodic, Anti-viral, Astringent, Carminative, Diuretic, Immuno-stimulant, Liver supporter, Lymph decongest, Rubefacient, Tonifying

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is safe for children.

Add a maximum of 2 drops (0.1 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 2%) for topical applications. 

Can be used topically to:

  • Aid against muscle spasms
  • Reduce inflammation
  • Sooth achy muscles
  • Fight fatigue
  • Prevent or fight infection
  • Relieve stress and anxiety
  • Fight free radicals
  • Cleanse liver
  • Relieve nausea
  • Aid digestion
  • Fight respiratory infection
  • Lower blood pressure
  • Reduce fluid retention
  • Stimulate immune system
  • Nourish skin

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Fight fatigue
  • Relieve stress and anxiety
  • Stimulate immune system
  • Fight respiratory infection
  • Purify the air

Can be used around the house to:

  • Disinfect surfaces/filters – try adding drops or spray to furnace/air/vacuum filters! *avoid open flame
  • Freshen Laundry
  • Remove sticky residue (stickers, glue)
  • General household cleaning
  • Shine tarnished silver

 

Energetics

Lemon supports the 2nd, 3rd, and 6th chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand & Young have shown that Lemon essential oil is phototoxic and should not be used topically above concentrations of 2% on areas of skin that will be exposed to sunlight in the next 12 hours.  This oil is harmful when oxidized (including risk of sensitization), non-irritating and may be safe during pregnancy. [1]

Avoid old or oxidized Lemon oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 2%

This oil is safe for children.

This oil has GRAS status.  (Generally regarded as safe)

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014

entry.title: Patchouli Organic Essential Oil
entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Singles
Price: 14.95 - 56.95 (5 variants)

Botanical Name: Pogostemon cablin

Botanical Family: Lamiaceae

Main Constituents:
Patchoulol: 30.02%

Plant Part: Leaves

Origin: India

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Processing Method: Steam Distilled

﻿Approximate Shelf Life: 6 - 8 Years

Aromatic Scent: A medium strength base note.  Earthy, Exotic, Musky, Resinous, Rich, Sensual, Warm and Woody.

Blends Well With: Bergamot, Cassia, Cedarwood, Clove Bud, Copaiba, Cypress, Geranium, Lavender, Myrrh, Neroli, Orange, Palmarosa, Rose, Sandalwood and Vetiver.

 

Properties

Anti-anxiety, Anti-Bacterial, Anti-depressant, Anti-fungal, Anti-inflammatory, Antioxidant, Anti-phlogistic, Anti-septic, Aphrodisiac, Astringent, Anxiolytic, Calming, Cicatrisant, Cooling, Cytophylactic, Deodorant, Diuretic, Febrifuge, Insect repellent, Sedative, Tonic, Wound healing.

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is safe for children.

Add a maximum of 10 drops (0.5 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 10%) for topical applications.

Can be used topically to:

  • Reduce inflammation
  • Fight fatigue
  • Increase urination
  • Detoxify
  • Control appetite
  • Aid digestion
  • Ease stress and anxiety
  • Fight free radicals
  • Relieve symptoms of depression
  • Nourish skin
  • Heal wounds
  • Treat acne
  • Relieve eczema and psoriasis
  • Reduce dandruff
  • Neutralize odors
  • Fight insomnia
  • Repel insects

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Relieve symptoms of depression
  • Ease stress and anxiety
  • Fight fatigue
  • Purify the air
  • Neutralize odors
  • Fight insomnia
  • Repel insects

Can be used around the house to:

  • Disinfect surfaces/filters – try adding drops or spray to furnace/air/vacuum filters! *avoid open flame
  • Freshen Laundry
  • Repel insects

 

Energetics

Patchouli supports the 1st, 2nd 3rd and 7th chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand & Young have shown that Patchouli may inhibit blood clotting.  Oral use is contraindicated with anticoagulant medication, major surgery, peptic ulcers, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders.  This oil is non-irritating and non-sensitizing. [1]  

Below are some of the known drug interactions for Patchouli.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Patchouli essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate interaction:

  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), and others.

Avoid Patchouli oil for 2 weeks before surgery.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 10%

This oil is safe for children.

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014

entry.summary:
Vendor: Mountain Wellness Products
Type: Essential Oil Singles
Price: 19.95 - 53.95 (4 variants)

Botanical Family: Lamiaceae

Main Constituents:
Carvacrol: 70.99%
Thymol: 2.55%

Plant Part: Herb

Origin: Albania

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Processing Method: Steam Distilled

﻿Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿3 - 4 years

Aromatic Scent: A strong middle note.  Camphorous, herbaceous, medicinal, powerful, pungent, spicy and warm.

Blends Well With: Bergamot, Cajeput, Cedarwood, Chamomile, Citronella, Cypress, Dill Weed, Eucalyptus, Lavender, Lemon, Geranium, Marjoram, Pine, Rosemary, Tea Tree and Thyme.

 

Properties

Analgesic, Anti-bacterial, Anti-fungal, Anti-inflammatory, Antioxidant, Anti-septic, Anti-viral, CNS sedative, Energizing, Expectorant, Immune support, Stomachic, Warming

 

Recommended Usage

Oregano essential oil can be hazardous, dilution levels found in our General Safety Guidelines do not apply.  Please follow the recommendations in the “Safety and Warnings” section below.

This oil is not safe for children.

Add a maximum of 1 drop (0.05 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 1.1%) for topical applications. 

Can be used topically to:

  • Reduce inflammation
  • Sooth achy muscles
  • Boost mood
  • Detoxify
  • Lower cholesterol
  • Maintain clear skin
  • Fight viruses
  • Prevent or fight infection
  • Fight free radicals
  • Aid digestion
  • Fight respiratory infection
  • Stimulate immune system
  • Reduce allergy symptoms
  • Boost digestion
  • Lower blood pressure
  • Assist weight loss
  • Repel insects

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Boost mood
  • Stimulate immune system
  • Fight respiratory infection
  • Purify the air
  • Repel insects

Can be used around the house to:

  • Disinfect surfaces/filters – try adding drops or spray to furnace/air/vacuum filters! *avoid open flame
  • Freshen Laundry
  • Repel insects

 

Energetics

Oregano supports the 1st, 2nd and 3rd chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand and Young have shown that Oregano oil inhibits blood clotting, is embryotoxic, has a low risk of skin irritation, moderate risk of sensitization and a moderate risk of mucous membrane irritation.  Oregano is contraindicated by all routes when pregnant or breastfeeding.  Avoid using on diseased or damaged skin and children under 2 years of age.  Orally contraindicated with diabetic medication, anticoagulant medication, major surgery, peptic ulcer, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders. [1] 

Below are some of the known drug interactions for Oregano oil.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Oregano essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate Interaction:

  • Lithium
  • Antidiabetic medications such as glimepiride (Amaryl), glyburide (DiaBeta, Glynase PresTab, Micronase), insulin, metformin (Glucophage), pioglitazone (Actos), rosiglitazone (Avandia), and others.
  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), and others.

Avoid Oregano oil for 2 weeks before surgery.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 1.1%

This oil is not safe for children (under 2 years).

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

This oil has GRAS status.  (Generally regarded as safe)

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014

  • Fight viruses
  • Fight free radicals
  • Ease respiratory ailments
  • Relieve symptoms of depression
  • Reduce stress
  • Reduce nausea
  • Support immune system
  • Stimulate libido
  • Fight parasites
  • Aid digestion
  • Fight fatigue
  • Stimulate hair growth
  • Repel insects
  • Ease toothache

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Fight viruses
  • Ease respiratory ailments
  • Relieve symptoms of depression
  • Reduce stress
  • Reduce nausea
  • Stimulate immune system
  • Stimulate libido
  • Fight fatigue
  • Purify the air
  • Repel insects

 

Energetics

Clove bud supports the 1st and 2nd chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand & Young have shown that Clove Bud essential oil can interact (through oral routes) with pethidine, MAOIs, indirect sympathomimetics, SSRIs, medications treating blood clotting, major surgery, peptic ulcer, hemophilia, and other bleeding disorders.  Avoid using on diseased or damaged skin or if hypersensitive.  Clove Bud oil may be embryotoxic and inhibit blood clotting.  This oil has a moderate risk of mucous membrane irritation and a moderate risk of sensitization. [1]  

Below are some of the known drug interactions for Clove Bud.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Clove Bud essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Moderate interaction:

  • Verteporfin – effectiveness is reduced.
  • MAOIs – Isocarboxazid (Marplan), Phenelzine (Nardil), Selegiline (Eldepryl, Emsam, Zelapar), Tranylcypromine (Parnate), and others.
  • SSRIs – citalopram (Celexa), escitalopram (Lexapro), fluoxetine (Sarafem, Prozac, Prozac Weekly, Selfemra, Rapiflux), fluvoxamine (Luvox, Luvox CR), paroxetine (Paxil, Paxil CR, Pexeva, Brisdelle), sertraline (Zoloft), and others.

Minor interaction:

  • Medications that slow blood clotting (Anticoagulant/Antiplatelet drugs) such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), diclofenac (Voltaren, Cataflam, others), ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin, others), naproxen (Anaprox, Naprosyn, others), dalteparin (Fragmin), enoxaparin (Lovenox), heparin, warfarin (Coumadin), and others.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 0.5%

This oil is not safe for children (2 years and under).

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014

entry.title: Eucalyptus Globulus Organic Essential Oil

Plant Part: Woods and Leaves

Origin: China

Cultivation Method: USDA Certified Organic

Processing Method: Steam Distilled

﻿Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿3 – 4 Years

Aromatic Scent: A strong top-middle note.  Camphoraceous, cool, fresh, herbaceous, sweet, and woody.

Blends Well With:  Angelica Root, Basil, Cajeput, Cedarwood, Citronella, Lavender, Lemon, Myrtle, Orange Sweet, Spearmint and Tea Tree.

 

Properties

Analgesic, Anti-anxiety, Anti-bacterial, Anti-fungal, Anti-infectious, Anti-inflammatory, Anti-microbial, Anti-neuralgic, Anti-rheumatic, Anti-septic, Anti-spasmodic, Anti-viral, Astringent, Balsamic, Cicatrisant, Decongestant, Deodorant, Depurative, Diuretic, Expectorant, Febrifuge, Hypoglycaemic, Immune support, Immuno-stimulant, Mucolytic, Rubefacient, Stimulant, Vermifuge, Vulnerary

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

Add a maximum of 20 drops (1 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 20%) for topical applications.

Can be used topically to:

  • Reduce inflammation
  • Ease muscle and joint pain
  • Ease symptoms of rheumatism
  • Fight bacterial infection, viruses, and parasites
  • Remedy insect bites and stings
  • Ease menstrual cramps and muscle spasms
  • Detoxify
  • Decongest
  • Deodorize
  • Heal wounds and scars
  • Ease respiratory ailments
  • Reduce fever
  • Fight allergies
  • Lower blood sugar
  • Support immune system
  • Fight fatigue
  • Ease headaches
  • Reduce fluid retention
  • Fight fungus

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Fight viruses
  • Fight infection
  • Decongest
  • Deodorize
  • Fight allergies
  • Heal wounds and scars
  • Ease respiratory ailments
  • Fight fatigue
  • Ease headaches
  • Support immune system
  • Purify the air

Can be used around the house to:

  • Disinfect surfaces/filters – try adding drops or spray to furnace/air/vacuum filters! *avoid open flame
  • Freshen Laundry
  • Deodorize
  • Remove sticky residue (stickers, glue)

 

Energetics

Eucalyptus Globulus supports the 2nd, 4th, and 6th chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand & Young have shown that Eucalyptus Globulus oil can cause CNS and breathing problems in young children, has a low risk of irritation and a low risk of sensitization. [1]  

Avoid old or oxidized Eucalyptus oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 20%

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014

Frankincense supports the 1st, 6th, and 7th chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand & Young have shown that Frankincense oil is harmful when oxidized (with a risk of sensitization) but is otherwise non-irritating and may be safe during pregnancy. [1]

Avoid old or oxidized Frankincense oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 4%.

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid old or oxidized Lavender oil.  Store in refrigerator to extend shelf life.

Plant Part: Herb

﻿Approximate Shelf Life: ﻿4 – 5 years

Aromatic Scent: A strong top note.  Cool, Fresh, Herbaceous, Minty, Strong, and Sweet.

Blends Well With: Basil, Bergamot, Black Pepper, Cajeput, Cedarwood, Coriander, Eucalyptus Globulus, Eucalyptus Radiata, Geranium, Lavender, Lemon, Lime, Mandarin, Marjoram, Palmarosa, Pine, Rosemary, Spearmint, Thyme, Vanilla, Wintergreen, Ylang-ylang.

 

Properties

Analgesic, Anesthetic, Anti-bacterial, Anti-depressant, Anti-galactagogue, Anti-inflammatory, Anti-phlogistic, Anti-septic, Anti-spasmodic, Anti-viral, Astringent, Carminative, Cephalic, Cholagogue, Cooling, Cordial, Decongestant, Digestive stimulant, Emmenagogue Expectorant, Febrifuge, Hepatic, Immuno-stimulant, Nervine, Stimulant, Stomachic, Sudorific, Vasoconstrictor, Vasodilator.

 

Recommended Usage

See our General Safety Guidelines for recommended usage.

This oil is not safe for children.

Add a maximum of 5 drops (0.25 mL) to 5 mL of carrier oil (or 5.4%) for topical applications.

Can be used topically to:

  • Reduce inflammation
  • Soothe sore muscles and joints
  • Reduce muscle spasms
  • Ease symptoms of rheumatism
  • Boost circulation
  • Relieve itching
  • Reduce nerve pain
  • Cleanse liver
  • Detoxify
  • Fight fatigue
  • Boost concentration
  • Reduce bloating
  • Aid digestion
  • Fight symptoms of IBS
  • Relieve stress and anxiety
  • Repel insects
  • Reduce high blood pressure
  • Ease hangover
  • Sooth headaches
  • Promote a good sleep
  • Reduce nausea
  • Soothe sunburn
  • Stimulate hair growth
  • Fight acne
  • Reduce fever
  • Aid against respiratory disorders
  • Stimulate immune system

Can be diffused or inhaled to:

  • Relieve stress and anxiety
  • Aid against respiratory disorders
  • Fight fatigue
  • Boost concentration
  • Sooth headaches
  • Promote a good sleep
  • Stimulate immune system
  • Repel insects
  • Purify the air

Can be used around the house to:

  • Disinfect surfaces/filters – try adding drops or spray to furnace/air/vacuum filters! *avoid open flame
  • Freshen Laundry
  • Remove sticky goo (stickers, glue)

 

Energetics

Peppermint supports the 4th and 6th chakras.

 

Safety and Warnings

Tisserand & Young have shown that Peppermint oil is choleretic, neurotoxic in high doses, and has a low risk of mucous membrane irritation.  Peppermint is contraindicated through all routes with cardiac fibrillation, G6PD deficiency, and should not be applied on or near the face of infants or children.  Oral doses are contraindicated with cholestasis and cautioned with GERD. [1]

Below are some of the known drug interactions for Peppermint.  Check with your healthcare provider before using Peppermint essential oil if you are currently taking prescription medication.

Peppermint oil can interact with drugs metabolized by liver enzyme CYP3A4.

Severe interaction:

  • Weak CYP3A4 Inhibitors such as Lomitapide (>40mg)

Serious interaction:

  • Weak CYP3A4 inhibitors such as Lonafarnib, Eliglustat, or Lomitapide (>30mg or <=40mg)

Moderate interaction:

  • Weak CYP3A4 inhibitors such as Ubrogepant, Lemborexant, or Lomitapide (<=30mg)

Other interactions (may be mild to severe, more research needed):

  • Acetylcholinesterase inhibitors such as Donezepil
  • Adrenaline B-receptor antagonists such as Carvedilol or Propranolol
  • Opioid analgesics such as Alfentanil, Codeine, Fentanyl, or Methadone
  • Angiotensin II-receptor antagonists such as Losartan
  • Antiarrhythmic drugs such as Amiodarone (class III), Lidocaine (class Ib), or Quinidine (class Ia)
  • Tricyclic antidepressants such as Amitriptyline, Clomipramine, or Imipramine
  • Other antidepressants such as Mirtazapine
  • Antidiabetic drugs such as Glibenclamide
  • Antifungal drugs such as Itraconazole or Ketoconazole
  • Antipsychotic drugs such as Haloperidol or Pimozide
  • Benzodiazepines such as Diazepam, Midazolam, or Triazolam
  • Calcium channel blockers such as Diltiazem, Felodipine, Nicardipine, Nifedipine, Nitrendipine, or Verapamil
  • Chemotherapeutic drugs such as Cyclophosphamide, Doxorubicin, Vinblastine, or Vincristine
  • Dopamine receptor antagonists such as Domperidone
  • Estrogen receptor agonists such as Estradiol or Ethinyl estradiol
  • Estrogen receptor antagonists such as Tamoxifen
  • Glucocorticoids such as Budenoside, Dexamethasone, Hydrocortisone, or Prednisolone
  • Histamine H1-receptor antagonists such as Astemizole, Chlorpheniramine, or Terfenadine
  • HMG Co-A reductase inhibitors such as Atorvastatin, Lovastatin or Simvastatin
  • Hypnotic drugs such as Zaleplon or Zopiclone
  • Immunosuppressants such as Cyclosporine or Tacrolimus
  • Nervous system stimulants such as Caffeine or Cocaine
  • Phosphodiesterase inhibitors such as Cilostazol or Sildenafil
  • Reverse-transcriptase inhibitors such as Nevirapine
  • Serotonin receptor agonists such as Buspirone (5-HT1A) or Cisapride (5-HT4)
  • Serotonin 5-HT3-receptor antagonists such as Ondansetron
  • Serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) such as Citalopram or Sertraline

We do not recommend topical use in concentrations above 5.4%

This oil is not safe for children.

Avoid when pregnant or breastfeeding.

References

  1. Tisserand & Young Essential Oil Safety, 2ndEdition Churchill Livingstone Elsevier. Edinburg 2014
